FuncDef:
The dot1x mc-trigger port-up-send enable command enables the function of triggering 802.1X authentication through multicast packets immediately after an interface goes Up.
The undo dot1x mc-trigger port-up-send enable command disables the function of triggering 802.1X authentication through multicast packets immediately after an interface goes Up. The dot1x mc-trigger port-up-send enable command enables the function of triggering 802.1X authentication through multicast packets immediately after an interface goes Up. The undo dot1x mc-trigger port-up-send enable command disables the function of triggering 802.1X authentication through multicast packets immediately after an interface goes Up. By default, the function of triggering 802.1X authentication through multicast packets immediately after an interface goes Up is disabled. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K and CE6820S.
